reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision GBV Services through Mobile Teams in Northwest Syria

description.narrative: Maram Foundation will work through this project to reduce GBV effect by targeting vulnerable and conflict-affected IDPs in13 widows' camps in Idleb, Al Dana (Atma, Aqrabat, Qah, Babesqa, Deir Hassan), as well as the surrounding camps, 23500 BNFs (7500 girls, 12000 women,1800 boys amp 2200 men) including 1446 families (4865 of widows). The provision of GBV services in these areas will respond to critical issues, mainly discrimination, violence, economic exploitation, movement restrictions, SEA, forced and early marriage those widows, girls and PWDs exposed to, according to the data collected. It will also focus on strengthening elements of the preparedness and response to the COVID-19 pandemic as well as to adapt activities according to the GBV SC guidance note on COVID19. In addition, this project will be complementary with existing projects in the targeted areas (MF WGSS centres: Jasmin 2amp4). MF conducts all activities in close coordination with local actors, and according to the Guidance Note: Mitigating Protection Risks in IDP Sites, many stakeholders share the responsibility of ensuring the protection of affected populations throughout the entire life cycle of a site /Feb2019/. MF has running projects in the targeted locations and two WGSS centres (the first WGSSs in this area) including midwives who provide simple services of RH. MF also ensures coordination with organizations working in the same region and/or protection, GBV actors. MF is conducting activities in 9 widows’ camps through WGSSs ongoing project since Jan 2020, with permission renewed on monthly basis. During May 2020 an assessment took place, recommendations mentioned the necessity of Safe Spaces inside widows’ camps (Annex 3), which include lessons learned and solutions suggested. The project will be implemented on stages: 1, coordinating with the camp administration in order to secure a place for the project activities that take into account the confidentiality amp safety of the activities. If no secured place, MF will create a tent as WGSS. 2, An elected committee of women amp girls including PWDs amp elderly women (in each camp), is going to participate in decision-making to determine the identity of the place, the type of activities, empowerment topics and future modality of their lifestyle. 3, 13 of mobile teams will be implementing the project’s activities, each team consists of a case manager who will provide CM both in-person and remotely, according to the COVID19 response stage outlined in the GBV SC guidance note of COVID-19, Also, PSS worker and female facilitator for each camp, and another male facilitator will be targeting men amp boys who live near the widows' camps, local authorities and councils. 4, MF will conduct empowerment courses for women, to enhance economic capacity, in order to rely on themselves, especially sewing, so they will have a role in producing masks as a kind of preparation to respond to the spread of the epidemic. 5, MF WGSSs will conduct training for medical workers and first responders in order to respond to GBV cases, especially in light of the spread of COVID19. Also, training for workers on PFA, GBV, PSEA referral mechanism and will focus on the activities that enhance the well-being of staff. MF has full access to widows’ camps, with solid relationships with local communities, camps management and IDP representation committees (Annex 8).In September 2019, GBV SC recommended MF as a reputable NGO with vast experience in protection and Gender-Based Violence programs, and proven accessibility in northwest Syria.MF has been identified and recommended by the GBV SC as a reputable NGO with vast experience in protection and GBV programs, and proven accessibility in NW Syria. Also, are firmly committed to the global fight to eradicate SEA and have 4 technical acting members within the UN-OCHA PSEA meetings.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
